intro: Stylidium rhynchocarpum, commonly known as the burr stylidium, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Its unique feature is the presence of a burr-like structure at the base of the flower, which aids in seed dispersal. Stylidium rhynchocarpum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
